WorkItem.Description: I dont know if this effects any other module or just bear, but I was attempting to eliminate Threat from my gear choices. There really isnt any threat concerns atm, so I wanted to focus on "Survival + Mitigation". When I sort it in that manner, then attempt to change to a new gear slot I get an error. The same error also pops up if I attempt to equip an item. It appears to equip it fine, but cannot refresh the sort with the new stats.  In order to avoid the error, I just reset the sorting method back to "Overall", then equip (or change slots) and then reapply the "Survival + Mitigation" sort.

Comments.Message:
Here is the copy from the debug in the error box....

[Arg_BogusIComparer]
Arguments: ComparisonCalculationBase,System.Array+FunctorComparer`1[Rawr.ComparisonCalculationBase]
Debugging resource strings are unavailable. Often the key and arguments provide sufficient information to diagnose the problem. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=106663&Version=4.0.51204.0&File=mscorlib.dll&Key=Arg_BogusIComparer

   at System.Collections.Generic.ArraySortHelper`1.Sort(T[] keys, Int32 index, Int32 length, IComparer`1 comparer)
   at System.Array.Sort[T](T[] array, Int32 index, Int32 length, IComparer`1 comparer)
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1.Sort(Comparison`1 comparison)
   at Rawr.UI.GraphDisplay.FilterTopXGemmings(List`1 listItemCalculations)
   at Rawr.UI.GraphDisplay.UpdateGraphGear(String subgraph)
   at Rawr.UI.GraphDisplay.UpdateGraph()
   at Rawr.UI.ChartPicker.SetCurrentGraph()
   at Rawr.UI.ChartPicker.Grid_MouseLeftButtonUp(Object sender, MouseButtonEventArgs e)
   at MS.Internal.CoreInvokeHandler.InvokeEventHandler(Int32 typeIndex, Delegate handlerDelegate, Object sender, Object args)
   at MS.Internal.JoltHelper.FireEvent(IntPtr unmanagedObj, IntPtr unmanagedObjArgs, Int32 argsTypeIndex, Int32 actualArgsTypeIndex, String eventName)

Also I will attach my file just in case it is any help to you.
We are aware of this issue. You can avoid it by not sorting under one of the "X+Y" sorts when changing charts, you can switch back once you are at the new chart.
